citation.article-title: Thioalkalivibrio thiocyanoxidans sp. nov. and Thioalkalivibrio paradoxus sp. nov., novel alkaliphilic, obligately autotrophic, sulfur-oxidizing bacteria capable of growth on thiocyanate, from soda lakes.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thioalkalivibrio thiocyanoxidans sp. nov.

Thioalkalivibrio thiocyanoxidans (thi.o.cy.an.ox'i.dans. Gr. n. thios sulfur; Gr. adj. cyan blue; N.L. n. thiocyanatum thiocyanate; N.L. v. oxido to oxidize; N.L. part. adj. thiocyanoxidans oxidizing thiocyanate)
The cells are short vibrios (0.5-0.6x0.8-1.4 μm), and each has a single polar flagellum.
Thiocyanate-grown cells have extended periplasmic compartments.
Obligately alkaliphilic.
Growth is possible within the salinity range 0.3-1 M Na+ total salts, and for some strains growth is possible at concentrations up to 4.3 M.
The extremely salt-tolerant strains produce a membrane-bound yellow pigment.
Obligately chemolithoautotrophic.
Differs from the other Thioalkalivibrio species by the ability to grow with thiocyanate as the sole energy, nitrogen and sulfur source, producing cyanate as an intermediate.
Also oxidizes sulfide, thiosulfate, polysulfide, elemental sulfur and tetrathionate to sulfate.
Does not oxidize carbon disulfide.
Some strains have cyanase activity.
The G­+C content of the DNA (four strains) is 66.2-66.9 mol% (Tm).
Isolated from soda-lake sediments.
Other properties are as for the genus.
The type strain, ARh 2T (=DSM 13532T=JCM 11368T), is a yellow-coloured, extremely natronotolerant bacterium able to grow in soda brines (up to 4.3 M Na+).
Cyanase activity is absent.
DNA G­C content is 66.2 mol% (Tm).
Isolated from a Kenyan soda lake.
The GenBank 16S rDNA sequence accession number is AF302081
